issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.summary: Standardize fall-back value of test.build.data for testing directories

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.
status.name: Open

fields.description: Because some of the system properties aren't available in Eclipse environment and there's a sufficient number usages of 'test.build.data' system property the chances are that some of the tests won't work in Eclipse. There were two occasions of such behavior which were fixed already (see HDFS-601, HDFS-614). Although many more are left intact for post append time frame
fields.summary: HDFS code is extensively using system property 'test.build.data' which is likely to fail under Eclipse environment

comments.body: FWIW, the Eclipse templates in https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/HDFS-598 specify test.build.data, and a couple other things.  That said, I'm very much +100 for standardizing on how to get at this sort of thing from code, as opposed to environment variables.
In the above comment I've used a wrong name for the system property. It always should read 'test.build.data'. Thanks for indirectly pointing this out, Philip!
This has been discussed before, in a more general sense

My last comment wasn't particularly insightful without context: it was part of me linking this issue to HADOOP-5916.  This may be considered a duplicate or extension of that issue.  It would be great if we could be tidy with our files and stick to build and keep Eclipse happy.
